attributes.name: ErrorCache
attributes.description: This class caches errors based on urls. You shouldn't have to interact with this class.

methods.name: compute
methods.description: returns the state

methods.name: load
methods.description: Loads the connections as specified in the config options

methods.name: activate
methods.description: Activates the a single connection

params.name: {name,
params.description: config}

methods.name: lookup
methods.description: Looks up the connection from the container. Prioritizes the consuming app's connections over the addon's connections.

returns.description: a local connection or a connection from the addon

methods.name: find
methods.description: find - finds sounds in the cache by urls

attributes.name: Evented
attributes.description: Partial wrapper for Ember's Evented Mixin, enabling a pure class-based derivation

attributes.name: ObjectCache
attributes.description: This class caches things based on a strings or objects. You shouldn't have to interact with this class.

attributes.name: SharedAudioAccess
attributes.description: This class handles sharing a single audio element between multiple sounds. A desktop browser can generally handle multiple audio elements, but mobile browsers require some extra consideration. Using a single element and switching out the src allows us to play a piece of audio seamlessly without requiring an extra click by the user to get around strict autoplay restrictions

methods.name: resolveUrls
methods.description: URLs given to load or play may be a promise, resolve this promise and get the urls or promisify an array/string and return a promise resolving to a cleaned up array of URLS

attributes.name: SoundCache
attributes.description: This class caches sound objects based on urls. You shouldn't have to interact with this class.

methods.name: find
methods.description: find - finds sounds in the cache by urls

methods.name: remove
methods.description: remove - removes a sound from the cache

methods.name: cache
methods.description: cache - caches the sound by the url

attributes.name: SoundProxy
attributes.description: This class lazy loads sounds based on identifiers

attributes.name: UrlCache
attributes.description: This class caches url resolutions. You shouldn't have to interact with this class.

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Caches promise resolutions to urls, or just resolves the urls

attributes.name: {{autoplay-allowed}}
attributes.description:
A helper to get whether or not autoplay is allowed on the webpage.

 {{#if (autoplay-allowed)}}
    Autoplay is allowed
 {{/if}}

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

attributes.name: {{current-sound}}
attributes.description:
A helper to get the currently playing/paused sound.

 {{current-sound}}

 {{#if (sound-is-playing (current-sound))}}
   Something in this app is playing!
 {{/if}}

attributes.name: {{fastforward-sound}}
attributes.description:
A helper to fast forward a sound by x.

 <button {{on 'click' (fastforward-sound @identifier increment=5000)}}>
  Fast Forward
</button>

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

params.name: increment
params.description: time in ms

attributes.name: {{find-sound}}
attributes.description:
A helper to find (or wait) for a loaded sound.

 {{#let (find-sound @identifier) as |sound|}}
   //do something with the sound when it loads or if it's loaded
 {{/let}}

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

attributes.name: {{load-sound}}
attributes.description:
A helper to load a sound

  <button {{on 'click' (load-sound @identifier}}>
    Load
  </button>

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

params.name: metadata?
params.description: metadata that should be included with the sound

params.name: useConnections?
params.description: array of connection names in preference order

attributes.name: {{pause-sound}}
attributes.description:
A helper to load a sound

  <button {{on 'click' (play-sound @identifier}}>
    Play
  </button>

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

attributes.name: {{play-sound}}
attributes.description:
A helper to load a sound

  <button {{on 'click' (play-sound @identifier}}>
    Play
  </button>

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

params.name: metadata?
params.description: metadata that should be included with the sound

params.name: useConnections?
params.description: array of connection names in preference order

attributes.name: {{rewind-sound}}
attributes.description:
A helper to rewind a sound by x.

<button {{on 'click' (rewind-sound @identifier increment=15000)}}>
  Rewind 15 seconds
</button>

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

params.name: increment
params.description: time in ms

attributes.name: {{seek-sound}}
attributes.description:
A helper to seek a sound

  <button {{on 'click' (seek-sound @identifier 15000)}}>
    Jump ahead 15s
  </button>

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

params.name: unit?
params.description: 'percentage' or 'seconds', defaults to 'percentage'

attributes.name: {{sound-duration}}
attributes.description:
A helper to get a sound's duration in milliseconds.

 <p>Duration of loaded sound is {{sound-duration @identifier}}ms</p>
 <p>Duration of loaded sound in h:mm:ss {{sound-duration identifier format=time}}</p>
 <p>Duration of sound that this helper just tried to load in h:mm:ss {{sound-duration identifier format=time load=true}}</p>

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

params.name: format?
params.description: time, ms,

params.name: defaultValue?
params.description: time when duration is unknown

params.name: load?
params.description: load the sound if it's not loaded?

attributes.name: {{sound-error-details}}
attributes.description:
A helper to display error details.

{{sound-error-details @identifier}}

{{sound-error-details @identifier connectionName="NativeAudio"}} // only display errors from native audio

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

params.name: connectionName?
params.description: name of connection's errors to get

attributes.name: {{sound-is-blocked}}
attributes.description:
A helper to detect if a sound is blocked.

  {{#if (sound-is-blocked @identifier)}}
    <p>This sound has been blocked by browser autoplay. User intervention is required</p>
  {{else}}
    <p>This sound has not been blocked by browser autoplay</p>
  {{/if}}

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

attributes.name: {{sound-is-errored}}
attributes.description:
A helper to detect if a sound is errored.

  {{#if (sound-is-errored @identifier)}}
    <p>This sound is errored</p>
  {{else}}
    <p>This sound is not errored</p>
  {{/if}}

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

params.name: format
params.description: time, ms, s,

params.name: load
params.description: load the sound if it's not loaded?

attributes.name: {{sound-is-fastforwardable}}
attributes.description:
A helper to detect if a sound is fastforwardable.

  {{#if (sound-is-fastforwardable @identifier)}}
    <p>This sound is fastforwardable</p>
  {{else}}
    <p>This sound is not fastforwardable</p>
  {{/if}}

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

params.name: load?
params.description: load the sound if it's not loaded

attributes.name: {{sound-is-loaded}}
attributes.description:
A helper to detect if a sound is loaded.

  {{#if (sound-is-loaded @identifier)}}
    <p>The sound is loaded</p>
  {{else}}
    <p>This sound is not loaded</p>
  {{/if}}

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

attributes.name: {{sound-is-loading}}
attributes.description:
A helper to detect if a sound is loading.

  {{#if (sound-is-loading @identifier)}}
    <p>This sound is currently loading</p>
  {{else}}
    <p>This sound is not currently loading</p>
  {{/if}}

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

attributes.name: {{sound-is-playing}}
attributes.description:
A helper to detect if a sound is playing.

{{#if (sound-is-playing @identifier)}}

{{else}}
  <p>This sound is not currently playing</p>
{{/if}}

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

attributes.description:
A helper to detect if a sound is playing.

{{sound-metadata (current-sound)}} // currently loaded sound metadata hash
{{sound-metadata @identifier key=title}} // metadata 'title' on sound matching @identifier

attributes.name: {{sound-position}}
attributes.description:
A helper to get a sound's position.

 {{sound-position @identifier}} #=> 144000
 {{sound-position @identifier format="time"}} #=> "02:24"
 {{sound-position @identifier format="percent"}} #=> "56"

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

params.name: format
params.description: time, percent,

attributes.name: {{stereo-volume}}
attributes.description:
returns current stereo volume when used as a helper. When used as a modifier it transforms an range input control into a volume control

  {{!-- use it as a helper like this --}}
  The stereo system volume is set at {{stereo-volume}}

  {{!-- use it as a modifier like this --}}
  <label>
    I control the stereo volume
    <Input @type="range" {{stereo-volume}}/>
  </label>

attributes.name: {{stop-sound}}
attributes.description:
A helper to stop a sound

  <button {{on 'click' (stop-sound @identifier)}}>
    Stop
  </button>

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

attributes.name: {{toggle-play-sound}}
attributes.description:
A helper to toggle play/pause a sound

  <button {{on 'click' (toggle-play-sound @identifier)}}>
    Play/Pause
  </button>

params.name: identifier
params.description: url, urls, url objects, promise that resolves to a url

params.name: metadata?
params.description: metadata that should be included with the sound

params.name: useConnections?
params.description: array of connection names in preference order

attributes.name: {{toggle-stereo-mute}}
attributes.description:
A helper to toggle stereo's mute status

  <button {{on 'click' (toggle-stereo-mute)}}>
    Toggle Mute
  </button>

attributes.name: stereo
attributes.description: This is the stereo service class.

fields.name: isBlocked
fields.description: is user input needed to allow an autoplay request?

fields.name: currentMetadata
fields.description: Current metadata object of the current sound. Use {{sound-metadata}} helper in templates

fields.name: currentMetadata
fields.description: Current metadata object of the current sound. Use {{sound-metadata}} helper in templates

fields.name: isStream
fields.description: is the current sound a stream?

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of current sound in milliseconds. Use {{numeric-duration}} to convert, or the {{sound-duration url format=time}} template helper

fields.name: isMobileDevice
fields.description: Get/set if hifi should treat this as a mobile device

fields.name: useSharedAudioAccess
fields.description: get if hifi should use a shared audio element

fields.name: connections
fields.description: Returns the list of activated and available connections

methods.name: toggleMute
methods.description: Toggles mute state. Sets volume to zero on mute, resets volume to the last level it was before mute, unless unless the last level was zero, in which case it sets it to the default volume

methods.name: loadTask
methods.description: Ember concurrency task: Given an array of URLS, return a sound ready for playing

returns.description: A sound that's ready to be played, or an error

params.name: urlsOrPromise
params.description: [..{Promise|String}]

params.name: options
params.description: { metadata: {},

methods.name: load
methods.description: Given an array of URLS, return a sound ready for playing

returns.description: A sound that's ready to be played, or an error

params.name: urlsOrPromise
params.description: An array of urls or a promise that will resolve to an array of urls

methods.name: playTask
methods.description: Given an array of URLs, return a sound and play it.

returns.description: A sound that's playing, or an error

params.name: urlsOrPromise
params.description: An array of urls or a promise that will resolve to an array of urls

methods.name: play
methods.description: Given an array of URLs, return a sound and play it.

returns.description: A sound that's playing, or an error

params.name: urlsOrPromise
params.description: Provide an array of urls to try, or a promise that will resolve to an array of urls

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Pauses the current sound

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the current sound

methods.name: togglePause
methods.description: Toggles play/pause state of the current sound

methods.name: fastForward
methods.description: Fast forwards current sound if able

params.name: duration
params.description: in ms

methods.name: rewind
methods.description: Rewinds current sound if able

params.name: duration
params.description: in ms

methods.name: currentSound
methods.description: Set the current sound and wire up all the events the sound fires so they trigger through the service, remove the ones on the previous current sound, and set the new current sound to the system volume

methods.name: loadConnections
methods.description: Loads stereo connections

params.name: connections
params.description: an array of connection objects

methods.name: findLoadedSound
methods.description: Given a sound, a url, or an object with a URL property, return a sound ready for playing

returns.description: A sound that's ready to be played, or an error

params.name: identifiers
params.description: [..{Promise|String}]

methods.name: removeSound
methods.description: Given a sound, a url, or an object with a URL property, return a sound ready for playing

returns.description: A sound that's ready to be played, or an error

params.name: identifier
params.description: [..{Promise|String}]

methods.description: Wait for sound to succeed

params.name: strategy
params.description: a connection strategy object

params.name: strategy

params.name: sound

methods.name: tryLoadingSound
methods.description: Try loading sound

params.name: strategy
params.description: a connection strategy object

methods.name: _setCurrentPosition
methods.description: Sets the current sound with its current position, so the sound doesn't have to deal with timers. The service runs the show.

methods.name: _registerEvents
methods.description: Register events on a current sound. Audio events triggered on that sound will be relayed and triggered on this service

methods.name: _unregisterEvents
methods.description: Register events on a current sound. Audio events triggered on that sound will be relayed and triggered on this service

methods.name: _relayEvent
methods.description: Relays an audio event on the sound to an event on the service

params.name: eventName,
params.description: sound

methods.name: _createAndUnlockAudio
methods.description: Creates an empty audio element and plays it to unlock audio on a mobile (iOS) device at the beggining of a play event.

methods.name: _attemptToPlaySound
methods.description: Attempts to play the sound after a load, which in certain cases can fail on mobile

attributes.name: Sound
attributes.description: This is the base sound object from which other sound objects are derived.

attributes.name: HLS
attributes.description: This class connects with HLS.js to create sounds.

attributes.name: Howler
attributes.description: This class connects with Howler to create sounds.

attributes.name: NativeAudio
attributes.description: This class connects with the native audio element to create sounds.
